This might sound really stupid but... a bee flew into the room during this practice. I have always had an immense phobia of bees. I would get up from a dinner table and run away, scream and flail about and freak out in public if they fly near me (yes, I've been told 1000 times to just be still, it doesn't help haha). And yet, when this bee flew in and I saw it land on the curtain, I just acknowledged it, dissolved any tension/stress within my body, and continued with my practice in stillness. I usually would have ran out of the room and locked the door, even if it was nowhere near me! But I shared my space with that lil bee (actually, it's pretty big), and it kindly stayed nice and silent... all the way until the final few moments, with our hands together taking our final few breaths together. My eyes were closed, it started buzzing, I couldn't see where it was going, what it was doing. My body started to tense up, but I relaxed into it, found the stillness, and finished up the practice. What an amazing experience for me!
